intro: Hieracium sulphurellum, commonly known as the sulphur hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are hairy and have a rough texture, while its stems are upright and often branched. The species is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environments, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
